title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: As he ran fast, he ran far, until, when he hadput at least a mile between him and CramondBridge, he came to the verge of the thicket. Safenow at least from immediate pursuit, he peeredout into the open and drew a long breath; but hehad scarcely done so when two arms closed roundhim like bands of steel, and a shrill whistle at hisear nearly deafened him.
